briefdescription.para: Tag type used to indicate skipping default initialization.

detaileddescription.para: `no_init_t` is a tag type that signals to constructors or factory functions that default initialization should be skipped. This is useful for performance-critical code paths where objects will be immediately overwritten or initialized manually.
Pass `no_init` as a constructor argument to request uninitialized storage:
// Generate a new unique Guid auto id = helios::util::Guid::generate();
// Declare uninitialized Guid for later assignment helios::util::Guid deferredId{helios::core::types::no_init};

simplesect.para: Objects constructed with `no_init` are in an indeterminate state. Reading from them before assignment is undefined behavior.
